title: Blackboard K-12 Customers Receive Top Honor for Outstanding Community Engagement Efforts
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/3/2015 @ 7:00 AM   Blackboard Inc. 
WASHINGTON, Sept. 3, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Blackboard Inc. congratulates Brevard County Public Schools, Eden Prairie Schools, Oklahoma City Public Schools, Portland Public Schools and West St. Paul-Mendota Heights-Eagan Area Schools, recipients of National School Public Relations Association's (NSPRA) 2015 Gold Medallion Award . The recognition is further evidence of how Blackboard's outstanding community engagement solutions are helping K-12 school districts inform and engage local stakeholders. 
NSPRA's top program award, the Gold Medallion, recognizes superior educational public relations programs from public and private schools, vocational-technical schools or community colleges beyond 12th grade, and the education groups, public relations agencies or corporations serving the institutions. Winners were announced at the NSPRA National Seminar held in July. 
The five Blackboard K-12 customers recognized by NSPRA use products included in the company's community engagement solution to inform and engage local communities about issues that impact them. 
For example, parents in Portland Public Schools (PPS) showed concern for decreased enrollment at a particular district high school and set out to increase total enrollment growth by 65 percent from 2014-15 to 2015-16. PPS set short-term grassroots and viral marketing goals that were each exceeded as part of the campaign with help of Blackboard's community engagement solutions. 
"We believe that community engagement is critical to learner success and safety in K-12," said Chris Crawford, head of Blackboard K-12 Community Engagement solutions. "We continue to work hard to deliver an unparalleled and robust set of solutions that advance the needs of learners and continually exceed the needs of our K-12 partners that support them. We are proud to say that five of the seven recipients of this year's award are our customers, and we congratulate all of the winners on their outstanding work." 
To learn more about the winners, visit http://www.nspra.org/gold_medallion . 
About Blackboard Inc. Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company. We challenge conventional thinking and advance new models of learning in order to reimagine education and make it more accessible, engaging and relevant to the modern-day learner and the institutions that serve them. In partnership with our customers and partners in higher education and K-12 as well as corporations and government agencies around the world, our mission is to help every learner achieve their full potential by inspiring a passion for lifelong learning.
